official-title.#text: To amend the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to limit assistance to the Palestinian Authority, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

quote.#text: Palestinian Peace Promotion and Anti-Incitement Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
It is the sense of
the Palestinian Authority has not fully lived up to its prior agreements with Israel to end incitement; and
the Palestinian Authority should do more to prepare the Palestinian people for peace with Israel.

header.#text: Limitation on assistance to the Palestinian Authority

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chapter 1 of part III of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

header.#text: Limitation on assistance to the Palestinian Authority

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may be obligated or expended to provide assistance to the Palestinian Authority only during a period for which a certification described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: chapter 4 of part II of this Act

text.#text: Funds made available under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to the appropriate congressional committees that contains a determination of the President that the Palestinian Authority—

text.#text: A certification described in this subsection is a certification transmitted by the
no longer engages in a pattern of incitement against the United States or Israel; and
is engaged in peace preparation activities aimed at promoting peace with the Jewish State of Israel.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: transmits to the appropriate congressional committees an initial certification under

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall transmit to the appropriate congressional committees a recertification that the requirements contained in subsection (b) are continuing to be met; or

text.#text: the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is unable to make such a recertification, the President shall transmit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that contains the reasons therefor.

text.#text: if the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that details the justification for the certification or recertification, as the case may be, the purposes for which the funds will be spent, and the accounting procedures in place to ensure that the funds are properly disbursed.

text.#text: Whenever the
Such report shall also detail the steps the Palestinian Authority has taken to arrest terrorists, confiscate weapons, and dismantle the terrorist infrastructure.
In this section:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives
Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate

text.#text: The term

continuation-text.#text: that is sponsored, supported, or directed by officials or employees of the Palestinian Authority or Palestinian Authority-controlled, sponsored, or supported electronic, broadcast, and print media, schools, mosques, or institutions.

text.#text: The term
statements, media, communication, or other activities against any religion, ethnicity, or nationality,
advocacy, endorsement, or glorification of violence, martyrdom, or terrorism, or

endorsement, glorification, honor, or other memorialization of any person or group that has advocated, sponsored, or committed acts of terrorism, including the naming after or dedication to such person or group of any school, community center, camp, stadium, public square, street, land, landmark, waterway, or other facility,

term.#tail: means the interim Palestinian administrative organization that governs part of the West Bank and all of the Gaza Strip (or any successor Palestinian governing entity), including the Palestinian Legislative Council.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means Arabic-language communications and educational activities sponsored by the Palestinian Authority that are communicated or administered via electronic, broadcast and print media, schools, mosques, and statements by government officials that may include the following:

text.#text: The term
Public acknowledgments of the State of Israel’s right to exist as a Jewish state.
Firm public commitments to and endorsements of peaceful co-existence with the Jewish State of Israel.

term.#tail: and halting all production, distribution, or public display of maps that do not include a state of Israel.

text.#text: Production, distribution, and public display via all media platforms, schools, mosques, educational materials and elsewhere of maps that show the State of Israel existing as

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: takes effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and applies with respect to funds made available under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for fiscal year 2014 and subsequent fiscal years.
